{"step_by_step_thinking": "Branchial fistulas are remnants of embryonic development. They are caused by the persistence of the branchial clefts, which are part of the branchial apparatus. The branchial apparatus consists of branchial arches, clefts, and pouches. The most common type of branchial fistula is the second branchial cleft fistula.", "answer_choice": "C. 2nd branchial cleft."}
